intro: Thea gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Zealand tea tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is part of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. It thrives in coastal and forested areas, often growing in well-drained soils. Thea gaudichaudii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori medicine.
